TopicTitle: Is there a basic text editor mode for forum replies?

Articles.Content:
What it says on the tin.

Basically, I'm limited to browsing KSP forums with my phone right now.  Across several (android) browsers I've had some weird issues when positing, apparently they stem from JavaScript heavy WYSIWYG editors and can crop up on many browser/keyboard combinations.

If there's a  basic mode I can't find it, but if there is, maybe there's a way to default to it?

Sadly, no.

I've actually not bothered posting on occasion because what I was doing would require more than simply typing.

1 hour ago, Kyrt Malthorn said:

If there's a  basic mode I can't find it, but if there is, maybe there's a way to default to it?

This was asked for repeatedly during the IPS rollout... but there's still no plain-text editor.
Seems all our IPS switch time complains about the WYSI(S)WYG editor post mangler fell on deaf ears.

There's too much heavy JS on this site - it's slow as molasses, and the ridiculous fade-in and unnecessary UI-bling on the activity streams often hangs Firefox, on both mobile and desktop.
And don't get me started on the horrific mess that is quoting doing anything on this forum on mobile...
I'd take phpBB over this IPS abomination any day, it's essentially unusable on mobile, and extremely frustrating in general.

Edited October 13, 2016 by steve_v

Come to think of it, quoting was a factor...

Sadly mobile is my only access to the internet for the months ahead.

Thanks for the info.

9 minutes ago, Kyrt Malthorn said:

Come to think of it, quoting was a factor...

Yeah, if you try to quote in a mobile browser (tested in FF & stock Android) the editor post mangler goes berserk and traps the cursor in the quote box. Attempts to correct this only dig a deeper hole as there's no way to remove a quote on mobile...

Unfortunately the WYSIWYG editor is all that is available at the current time. We've looked into add-ons that would change the editor to be more similar to the old vB one but nothing suitable has been found. The only other option we currently have is to enable raw HTML editing, but we can't enable that for obvious reasons.

6 hours ago, steve_v said:

There's too much heavy JS on this site - it's slow as molasses, and the ridiculous fade-in and unnecessary.......

The sad thing is that a (well written) JS interface should really be nice and fast. But IPS seems to do some really bat-poop mental things with js and ajax that breaks some basic expected behaviours, like what happens to pressing "back" after going to the second page of a a thread. 
I pretty much dislike all WYSIAENWYG (what you see is almost entirely not what you get) editors but while looking around to back up my claim that all of them are horrible I came across https://froala.com/wysiwyg-editor. Now that is a JS wysiwyg editor done right! (have a look at the inline demo, the whole page is editable). Would be nice if IPS could adopt Froala as it's editor, but I doubt that will ever happen.
